main_definition: A receipt is a written acknowledgment that something, especially money, has been received.

meanings_and_examples.example: After buying groceries, I received a receipt showing the list of items and their prices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Record or proof that goods have been sold at certain price
meanings_and_examples.example: The store provided me with a receipt detailing the electronics I purchased, including the cost and taxes paid.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Statement of money received by an account holder
meanings_and_examples.example: I checked my bank's online portal to see the latest receipts for deposits made into my savings account.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acknowledgment that taxes or duties have been paid on a purchase
meanings_and_examples.example: Upon exporting goods, I was given an official receipt confirming payment of import duties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Confirmation that services rendered were compensated in full
meanings_and_examples.example: The contractor handed me the receipts for all completed work on my home renovation project.
